pages.text: A $(item)Spawner Extractor/$ is one of the two ways to obtain a $(l:spawning/spawner_core)Spawner Core/$, which you'll need if you want to use a $(l:spawning/pressurized_spawner)Pressurized Spawner/$.$(p)To use the Spawner Extractor, place it on top of a vanilla $(item)Spawner/$, which you'll need to find in the world somewhere.

Then, provide the Spawner Extractor with $(thing)-0.5 bar/$ of vacuum or lower, and prepare for a fight. It turns out that Spawners $(italic)really/$ don't like being extracted, and spawn mobs at a greatly increased rate to defend themselves. Some useful tips:$(li)The base extraction time is about 60 seconds.$(li)However, any nearby defending mobs will slow the extraction down, and too many will stall extraction.

$(li)There must be at least one player nearby or extraction will stall.$(li)If the $(thing)Spawner/$ isn't able to spawn defenders (e.g. bad light levels, ground missing...), the process will also slow down and eventually stall.$(p)Once extraction is complete, a $(thing)Spawner Core/$ is ejected, and the Spawner becomes an $(item)Empty Spawner/$. This block can (and should) be picked up, since it's used to craft a $(l:spawning/pressurized_spawner)Pressurized Spawner/$.
